page.title: 14The Public House at Hexton
page.content: The Public House at Hexton is called the Raven. It is a new building but it has been made to look old so that it matches the village houses. A landlord runs the pub and he employs ten workers. The Raven has a large bar where customers can drink beer and a large variety of alcoholic drinks. Children are not allowed in the bar but they may go into the pool room, where pool, darts and slot machines are played. There is a busy dining room where lunches and snacks are served each day. About 40 people visit the pub each night but there are more on Fridays and Saturdays. 12 people from the village regularly visit the Raven. The pub is open each day from 1130 to 1430 and from 1800 to 2230 hours.
